The Omni Berkshire Place has a concierge and friendly staff, with an elegant style, and is near 5th Avenue and Rockefeller Center. Some rooms feature marble bathrooms, bathrobes, and movie channels, and the hotel's restaurant and bar, Fireside, has a stylish atmosphere.

The On the Ave Hotel features sleek, minimalist decor and urban boutique feel, with some rooms offering panoramic views and balconies. The hotel is located in the Upper West Side, near Central Park and subway stations, providing a convenient and relatively quiet base for exploring the city.

The Park 79 Hotel is described as an old building, formerly a house, with an interior that is charming and on the old side. One review mentions the hotel "looked great on the website - all white and clean, modern with a hint of colonial, and lots of dark wood" but the reviewer found "it was nothing like the website. It was tatty, run down, and altogether rather naff".

The Park Central Hotel has a modern lobby, with black and white photos of New York throughout the hallways and elevators and is located across from Carnegie Hall. One reviewer mentioned the stone facade at the entrance.

The Park South Hotel has an art deco style, with a lobby decorated with leather couches and fresh flowers, plus a bar/bistro with a fireplace that has live jazz on weekends; some rooms have views of the Chrysler Building. The hotel also offers a free DVD library.
The Peninsula has an old-school opulent style without being garish, making it a place for grown-ups. It is located in a historic Beaux Arts building with rooftop views and elegant rooms.
The Phillips Club's lobby is stunning, and it is frequented by movie and TV stars in town for gigs. The hotel is a mix of hotel and condo, with stylish, modern rooms/suites and large flat-screen TVs.

The Plaza Athenee offers an intimate, European feel with elegant decor, a cozy bar, and a restaurant with Murano glass chandeliers. Some rooms have views of the Upper East Side, and the hotel is located on a quiet, tree-lined street near Central Park and upscale shopping.
The Radisson Martinique, an older hotel with character, is located near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square. Some rooms offer views, with a restaurant and bar on the premises.
This hotel was used as the outside shot for the hotel in Tom Hank's movie, "The Terminal". Guests can see the Chrysler building from the hotel.
The Red Roof Inn Manhattan features a bar/lounge overlooking the lobby and offers rooms with views of the Empire State Building. Some rooms include amenities such as flat-screen TVs and iPod docks.

The Renaissance 57 is a renovated boutique hotel with a sleek, modern, and chic European-inspired decor, aiming for a posh and sophisticated atmosphere. Some rooms offer great views of 57th and Lexington, with modern amenities and stylish details.

Located in the heart of Times Square, this hotel offers stunning views and places guests in the middle of the action, like a movie. Some reviewers noted the rooms have great views of Times Square, especially from the higher floors and the Foley's restaurant.

The hotel offers suites on the top floor with breathtaking views of the Empire State Building, and some rooms have three picture windows. The hotel is near many attractions and within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway theaters.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park offers harbor view rooms with a telescope, some guests describing the experience as a scene from a movie; champagne and chocolate are often provided to guests celebrating special occasions. The hotel’s bar, Rise, is located on the top floor and boasts an outdoor terrace and expansive view of the harbor and Statue of Liberty.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel is located next to Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center, and some rooms offer views of St. Patrick's Cathedral. The hotel is near many attractions, including 5th Avenue shopping, Broadway shows, and Times Square, making it ideal for exploring iconic NYC locations.

The Roger Smith Hotel has unique rooms with different decorations, art, and books, offering a homey feel, and is described as an older hotel with a boutique atmosphere and cozy bar. Some rooms have kitchenettes, and the hotel has a lobby art gallery.

The Roger Williams Hotel features a trendy and modern decor, a stylish lobby, and a bar/lounge area that aims to replicate the feel of a living room. Some rooms have terraces with Empire State Building views.

This trendy, modern, and hip hotel has a glass-walled indoor pool and swim-up bar often hosting lively parties with DJs, creating an exciting and unconventional atmosphere. The decor is retro/modern, sometimes with dim lighting and colored hallways, with unique room layouts like platform beds and wetroom-style bathrooms.

The Royalton Hotel has a trendy, hip, and luxurious atmosphere, often described as dark, moody, and romantic, with a recently renovated lobby featuring a fireplace. The hotel's design is unique and stylish, with features like dim lighting, candles, and sleek modern decor.

The Salisbury Hotel has an old-fashioned decor, and is located across from Carnegie Hall and the Russian Tea Rooms, which may give guests the feeling of being in a movie. The hotel's exterior doesn't stand out much, but the reception and hallways are quite plain and old-fashioned, which may enhance the older, movie-like feel.

The San Carlos Hotel is located near the Waldorf Astoria, with a tastefully decorated lobby that provides a calm and quiet ambience. Room options include suites with kitchenettes, and the hotel is within walking distance of Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, and Fifth Avenue shopping.
I am unable to fulfill this request. The reviews describe the hotel as basic, clean, and inexpensive, but do not mention anything that would make someone feel like they're in a movie.

The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers has a beautiful lobby that may make guests feel like they're in a movie, and rooms on higher floors offer phenomenal city views. The hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, and reviewers note the hotel has been the filming location for movies.

The Skyline Hotel has an art deco-style lobby that makes visitors feel like they are stepping back in time, and offers great views of the Manhattan skyline, especially from the penthouse pool. The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and the theater district.

The Smyth Tribeca is a stylish, modern hotel with a trendy lobby featuring cozy nooks and attractive staff; rooms have a Euro-modern design, sometimes with floor-to-ceiling windows offering city views, and often feature marble bathrooms with frosted glass walls. The hotel's design includes unique elements like robots and clocks in glass cases in the lobby and custom-made, chrome-accented furniture.
The Sofitel has a romantic 1930's feel and a lobby with a fire that seems to be lit all the time. The decor was on the edge of opulent, and there is a nice bar area with a french feel to it.

The Soho Grand has a "Blade Runner" feel, a dark and moody atmosphere with a classic "Gotham City" type of feel and unique vintage touches. It is a hip hotel with vintage touches and a lounge that buzzes in the evening.

The hotel's rooms are spacious and individually decorated with vintage and modern furniture, great sound systems, and oversized freestanding baths, and the hotel was featured in an episode of "Sex and the City". There is also a private cinema, a pool table, and board games in the bar.

The Stay Hotel has a trendy, chic, and modern lobby with funky lighting, aquariums, and the Aspen Social Club, a lodge-themed bar that turns into a nightclub on weekends. The hotel's architecture and design are unique, and the lobby is dimly lit for ambiance.

The Alex Hotel offers modern and sleek designed rooms with flat screen TVs, including one in the bathroom, providing a high-tech feel; some rooms offer views of the Chrysler Building. The hotel has a small bar and restaurant, Ringo, with a contemporary atmosphere.
The Belvedere Hotel has an Art Deco style lobby and offers skyline views from rooms on the higher floors. The hotel is located within short walking distance of many Broadway shows.

The Benjamin is a Beaux Arts-style boutique hotel with an elegant lobby, small mezzanine for meetings, and rooms featuring Bose radios playing classical music. Some rooms have balconies with city views.

The Blakely has an old-world feel with dark wood and European-style sofas in the lobby, and some reviewers mention an elegant British Colonial decor. Rooms have nice toiletries, bookshelves, and comfortable furnishings that give a homey feel.

The Bowery has a vintage, old-world design with dark wood panels, dimly lit passages, antique rugs, and rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows offering city views; its bar and lounge areas are warm and cozy with rich colors and vintage furnishings. The hotel aims for an authentic, old NYC style, creating a unique and special atmosphere.

The Bryant Park Hotel is a super swank and modern hotel with a striking red lobby, often buzzing with activity such as models and celebrities. Some reviewers mention the hotel has a dark cavernous bar with go-go dancers, and is close to many attractions such as Times Square, 5th Avenue shops, and the Empire State Building.

The Carlton on Madison has a grand and atmospheric lobby, with stylish, clean, cozy, and beautifully designed rooms, making guests feel like they are in a movie. Some reviewers mention the hotel's beautiful building, stunning lobby, beautiful decor, and Edwardian clubby bar atmosphere.

The Carlyle is a classic, old-school luxury hotel with a lobby and bars reminiscent of the 1930s or 40s, offering a glimpse into old New York with live jazz and art deco decor. Some rooms have Steinway grand pianos, and the hotel is known to host celebrities and heads of state, adding to the ambiance.

The Franklin Hotel is a small, charming boutique hotel with a European feel, featuring elements like a crystal chandelier, Bulgari toiletries, and a quaint sitting area. The hotel has an old-time elevator and offers complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings, creating a cozy and romantic atmosphere.
The French Quarters Guest Apartments has a New Orleans-themed decor and is described as elegant, gorgeous, charming, and beautiful. The hotel is located right on Restaurant Row near the theaters.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea has a modern, boutique style with interiors done in blacks, reds, and grays, and is decorated with spotlit orchids. Some reviewers mention a European feel and a chic, clean look.

The hotel is a smaller, modern, and stylish "boutique" hotel with minimalist Zen decor and a black-and-white color scheme with red accents, featuring flat-screen TVs in the rooms. Some rooms offer views, and bathrobes are included as a luxury touch.
The Gem Soho is located in a lively part of town near multiple cultural attractions and landmarks. The rooms are well-designed with flat screen TVs and iPod docks.

The Grant Hotel is an older building with a small, slow elevator that may remind you of a grandma's apartment in Chicago. Rooms have TVs with cable and are located in a neighborhood close to the subway and Central Park, which may be reminiscent of classic NYC films.

Located in the heart of the Theater District, this Hampton Inn is steps away from Broadway shows, Times Square, and various attractions in midtown Manhattan. Guests mention nearby musical theaters, such as the Gershwin, and easy access to a variety of restaurants and shops.

The Helmsley Carlton House offers spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes, in a quiet location one block from Central Park, with a beautifully decorated lobby and friendly, helpful staff. The hotel features elevator operators and has permanent residents.

The Helmsley Park Lane offers Central Park views and is located near various attractions such as Times Square and Fifth Avenue; some reviewers describe it as elegant and palatial with an old-fashioned charm. The hotel is described as having stylish furniture and a beautiful lobby and some found their room to be palatial and elegant.

The Herald Square Hotel, formerly the LIFE Magazine building, features LIFE photographs throughout, with some rooms newly renovated with high ceilings and chandeliers. Some rooms have a view of the Empire State Building, and some rooms can be dark with windows facing air shafts.

Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Manhattan's Chinatown, described as a bustling area that feels like another world, with fish markets and crowded streets. The hotel is near the Manhattan Bridge, with some rooms offering views of the bridge and the trains that run on it.
The Hotel at Times Square is located near the Theater District and Radio City Music Hall. The hotel rooms have been remodeled with flat screen TVs and iPod docks and the hotel has a cozy bar/lounge.

The Inn at Irving Place is located in a historic 19th-century townhouse, featuring authentic decor and antiques, offering guests a unique and gracious atmosphere, and is decorated for holidays. Some reviewers describe the Inn as feeling like a living room in a mansion with an opulent dining room and unique rooms.

The Iroquois Hotel is a small, sophisticated, and elegant boutique hotel with classic furnishings and a cozy lobby and library, reminiscent of a European-style hotel. Some suites, like the James Dean Suite, offer a unique and spacious experience.

The Jane Hotel offers small, cabin-style rooms with a vintage vibe, reminiscent of a sleeper train in the 1930s or a ship cabin, complete with wood paneling and retro decor details. The building itself has a historic charm, having sheltered Titanic survivors, and features a manually operated elevator and a lobby with vintage decor.

The Kimberly is a classic NYC hotel with ornate furnishings, antique replica-style furniture, and views of the Chrysler Building from the balcony suites. Some reviewers mention it feels like stepping back in time or like a movie setting.

The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel with individually owned rooms decorated with different themes and high-end, custom or semi-custom designs, offering a unique and potentially cinematic experience. The hotel features spacious rooms, some resembling apartments with kitchenettes, and is located in a central, classy area close to various attractions and amenities.

The London NYC has a modern and hip style with an active bar and lounge scene; it attracts celebrities and is close to many attractions like Times Square and Central Park. Some reviewers felt like they were in London rather than New York while inside the hotel, and the lobby and Maze restaurant are sleek and new.

The Lucerne is traditionally decorated, impeccably decorated with charming decor, flat screen TVs, and classically styled furnishings. The hotel has a traditionally decorated lobby, elegant hallways, and neighborhood that feels less hustle and bustle compared to being in mid-town.
The Manhattan Club is located across the street from Carnegie Hall and near Times Square. Some reviewers mention the hotel's location being great for experiencing the "energy of New York City".

The Mansfield Hotel is a small, turn-of-the-century boutique hotel with a luxurious and comforting ambiance, featuring a reading room with a fireplace, tall wooden bookcases, and cozy chairs. The hotel is decorated in an almost Gentleman's club feel with a book-lined library and leather chairs.
The Marcel at Gramercy is a trendy, modern, and funky boutique hotel with minimalist decor and stylishly designed rooms. It is in a neighborhood with a real New York feel.

The Maritime Hotel has a nautical theme with porthole windows, wood paneled rooms, and navy hallways designed to make guests feel like they are in a ship's cabin. The hotel offers a wide variety of DVDs to watch for free and is located in the Chelsea neighborhood with access to restaurants, shops, and nightlife.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping, and is frequented by non-resident actors. Some rooms have a TV in the bathroom mirror and remote-controlled features like electric shades.

The Marmara Manhattan offers spacious apartment-style suites with full kitchens, providing a sense of living like a New Yorker in a residential Upper East Side neighborhood, near Central Park and museums. Some suites, like the penthouse, offer breathtaking city views and luxurious accommodations, creating a memorable and impressive experience.
The Mave has vibrant red colors and balloons in the lobby, and is described as chic, stylish, and modern with bright rooms. It is located in midtown Manhattan near many attractions.

The Mercer is a trendy, chic, and hip boutique hotel in SoHo with a cool, collected lobby that is frequented by celebrities. The hotel's rooms have a minimalist style, and some offer nice views of the street.

The Michelangelo Hotel features a beautiful lobby with classical music, ornate Italian decor, marble floors, paintings, and chandeliers, creating an elegant and luxurious atmosphere. Some suites have unique styles of decor, and some rooms feature a Bose radio/CD player, marble bathrooms with oversized bathtubs, and TVs.

The Milburn Hotel is located in an old building on the Upper West Side with a recently refurbished lobby that is reminiscent of a European boutique hotel. It has a DVD library and some rooms have balconies.

The Muse Hotel features art deco themed rooms and a trendy, modern lobby to create a chic and sophisticated atmosphere with a fashionable clientele. Some rooms offer views of the Manhattan skyline with Times Square's lighted billboards visible.
The New York Helmsley has an old New York, swanky and dimly lit lobby and is near many sights, like the Chrysler Building. The staff is friendly and helpful.

The New Yorker Hotel has an art deco style with charming decor, offering a glimpse into the 1930s, and has appeared in movies like Grey Matters. The hotel has an iconic red sign and has been freshly decorated to maintain its art deco styling.

The Pierre is an iconic, grand hotel with old-world charm, featuring architectural details like a marble lobby, crown moldings, and elevator operators. Some reviewers describe it as luxurious and elegant, with a prime location across from Central Park.

The Plaza is a Beaux-Arts landmark hotel with a fabulous location, luxury surroundings, and spacious rooms appointed in a traditional style to recapture the original Plaza, with modern amenities such as flat screen TVs and iPod docks. Some rooms have high ceilings, elegant architectural details, and Versailles-like courtyard views, and the hotel has hosted weddings, photo shoots and wedding receptions.

The Pod Hotel has a funky and modern design, and some reviewers said staying there felt like being in a cabin on a ship, or a designerly dorm room. The lobby has murals, and music plays in the hallways and bathrooms.

The Premier is described as a boutique hotel within the Millennium Broadway, located half a block from Times Square, with some rooms offering views of the Chrysler Building and Times Square lights. It features modern, serene rooms, and is close to the theater district.
The Ritz-Carlton Central Park is known for celebrity sightings and a complimentary Bentley car service, which could enhance a "movie-like" experience. The hotel has a Star Lounge and Afternoon Tea.

The Roosevelt Hotel has a grand lobby and pre-war grandeur, with a history dating back to 1924, giving it a classic, old New York atmosphere. The hotel was also used as a filming location for the movie "Maid in Manhattan".

The Sherry-Netherland offers spacious rooms evoking an old Hollywood film, with decor that is classy and elegant. The elevators feature hand-painted details with medieval-style art, and the hotel provides extreme privacy.

The Shoreham is a modern, trendy, and stylish boutique hotel with a sleek lobby, hip music, and minimalist decor. Some rooms have features such as plasma TVs, Bose sound systems, and rainfall shower heads.

The St. Regis boasts luxurious, classically decorated rooms with opulent Victorian-style furnishings, some featuring details like crystal chandeliers, silk wall coverings, and pop-up flat-screen TVs, designed to evoke a sense of old-world glamour. Some suites, like the Imperial Suite, feature multiple rooms, including libraries, dining rooms, and marble foyers, enhancing the grand experience.
The Standard has floor-to-ceiling windows with city views and video art in the elevators. The modern design, combined with the Meatpacking District location, creates a trendy and unique atmosphere.

The Surrey is an elegant and classy hotel with luxurious furnishings and decor, and is located near Central Park and Madison Avenue. The rooms are spacious and have unique layouts, with some offering views of Central Park or Madison Avenue.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in a historical neighborhood near the Jumel Mansion, the oldest house in Manhattan, built in 1776 and used as General Washington's headquarters during the Revolutionary War. The guesthouse features a townhouse with African art decorations, well-equipped kitchens, and a terrace.

The Time Hotel has a modern, trendy style, with uniquely decorated rooms in blue, red, or yellow themes, with flat screen TVs, Bose radios, and a hip bar/lounge, and its location in the heart of the Theater District, near Times Square. Some guests note the hotel's unique design and decor, but others mention that the rooms are small and can be noisy.
The Waldorf Astoria is a historic hotel with a beautiful Art Deco lobby, ballrooms, and hallways. Guests report that the hotel oozes old-time class and transports them back to a more elegant era.

The Westin New York at Times Square offers corner rooms with great views of the Hudson River, the Empire State Building, Times Square, and the city, and it is connected to a movie theatre. The hotel is located one block from Times Square and features a modern, sleek design, including vintage-style rooms and panoramic windows.

The Thirty Thirty Hotel has a modern designed lobby and is near Times Square and Broadway, where "Mamma Mia" is playing. Some reviewers noted the hotel has been used in movies, and a stay at the hotel can coincide with a Sex and the City tour.
The hotel has a sleek, modern design with floor-to-ceiling windows offering great views of the city. The trendy, industrial decor echoes the Lower East Side's urban vibe.

The Travel Inn has a pool, and some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building or railway tracks, and depending on the room it may resemble a motel. The hotel is near the Theater District, and is an easy walk to Times Square where one may find Broadway performances.

The Tribeca Grand is described as trendy, chic, and stylish, with a hip vibe and modern decor, located in a popular section of the city, known for its soaring atrium lobby and the bar is a popular spot for parties. It is also the epicenter for the premier Tribeca Film Festival and screens movies in the basement theater.

The Trump International Hotel & Tower is located across the street from Central Park. Guests mention celebrity sightings, spacious rooms with plasma TVs, and high-end finishes like gold bathroom fixtures.

The Tudor Hotel is listed in the National Register of Historic Hotels and is located in the Tudor City neighborhood with views of the United Nations and East River. Some reviewers mention the hotel has a charming, old-world feel, with a quaint, small, dark wooden lobby.

The Avalon Vincci is an opulent hotel with a clean and inviting entrance, and some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building, creating a glamorous and special feel. Some reviewers mention that the hotel's style fits in with the rest of New York style.

The W - Court has a hip atmosphere, trendy decor, a happening bar scene, and some rooms offer views of the Chrysler and Empire State buildings. It's located in midtown, close to Grand Central Station and transportation, giving easy access to city attractions.

The hotel features a breakfast area with a video screen backdrop of New York-based 1950s film classics and Wet Bar in neighboring W Court Hotel. It has chic, classy, hip, stylish rooms with views of the Chrysler Building, and is located near Grand Central and the Empire State Building.

The W Times Square is a trendy and modern hotel with a "hip vibe", a cascading waterfall entrance, a bar/lounge with lots of people, and spectacular views of Times Square. Some guests have felt like a "movie star" in the quiet and comfortable rooms, while others describe the experience as being in a trendy club.

The W Union Square, occupying a historical building, has a stylish and chic atmosphere, with some reviewers describing it as hip and trendy with a lively bar scene. The hotel offers a bar adjacent to Olives Restaurant, and in the basement is Underbar.

The Waldorf Towers is a grand, historic hotel with Art Deco details, offering spacious suites with elegant, old-world decor reminiscent of the 1920s, and has been known to host celebrities and dignitaries. Breakfast in bed is recommended, delivered on a table with linen tablecloth and napkins, china, silver, crystal glasses, and a fragrant, fresh pink rose.

The Wall Street Inn has a charming interior design with a mix of colonial and turn-of-the-(20th)century era wall papering and linens, with rooms furnished in a boutique old-world European style. The hotel is tucked away on a quiet street one block from Wall Street and has a small, quiet, non-commercial atmosphere.

The Warwick is a historic hotel built by William Randolph Hearst with a classy and old-worldly ambiance, featuring Dean Cromwell murals in the restaurant, a bar with leather couches, and Cary Grant's former suite. The hotel has hosted celebrities like the Beatles, Elvis, and Cary Grant, and rooms are decorated in an art deco style.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel has an elegant lobby but is an older building with a small, slow elevator, and small rooms that some guests found depressing. Some rooms have views reminiscent of "West Side Story."

The Washington Square Hotel has a charming, art deco style with photos of movie stars, and is located in Greenwich Village, known for its bohemian vibe and history. The hotel has a jazz brunch and has been known to be frequented by musicians, singers, and actors.

The Wellington Hotel is described as a classic NY hotel with lots of character and charm, featuring an art deco lobby and having been featured in the movie Borat. Some found it a little old-fashioned, which added to the New York experience.

The hotel has technological enhancements and a Yamaha surround sound projector plus a separate Pioneer DVD player with full digital cable TV. Some rooms have floor to ceiling windows with city views from the bathtub.
I'm sorry, none of the hotel reviews mention the hotel's atmosphere or decor in a way that relates it to the atmosphere of movies.

The Wolcott Hotel, built in 1904, has a beautiful Beaux-Arts lobby and pre-war New York ambiance. The hotel has a historic feel, and the entrance lobby is described as grand, opulent, and like stepping back in time.

The Woogo offers a "New York" feel with apartment-style accommodations, including kitchenettes, making it feel like a mini-apartment. The hotel is near the Dakota building and a diner that resembles a 60's NYC film set.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel has a hip, trendy vibe, a chic style, modern decor, and photographs of the city hung all around, with a bar reminiscent of an era gone by. The 10th floor terrace also has amazing views.
